2018 Pass the SALT Schedule

The Pass the SALT (Security And Libre Talks) schedule is now published. We have very proud about the trust that all the submitters to our Call for Papers put in this first edition of PTS. We want thank all of them and we will try to do our best to deserve this trust. And now, just enjoy this schedule and come to share knowledge and cooperate.

Monday 2th of July, 2018

Reverse and Low-Level Session

  • 14:00 - 14:15: launching talk
  • 14:15 - 14:50: Frida2r2
    by Ole (Frida developer) and Pancake (r2 developer)
  • 14:50 - 15:25: Static instrumentation based on executable file formats
    by Romain Thomas (Lief developer, Quarkslab)
  • 15:25 - 16-00: RetDec: Machine-Code Analysis With Open-Source Decompiler
    by Jakub Kroustek (RetDec developer, Avast Software) and Peter Matula (RetDec main developer, Avast software)
~~~ afternoon pause ~~~
  • 16:20 - 16:55: Spectre: are there Spectre-based malware on your Android smartphone? by Head of Axelle core team (senior researcher, Fortinet)
  • 16:55 - 17:20: Cutter: A graphical user interface for radare2
    by Antide Petit (Cutter developer)

Tuesday 3rd of July, 2018

Network Security Session

  • 09:00 - 09:35: Traffic filtering at scale on linux
    by Francois Serman (OVH)
  • 09:35 - 10:10: Performance with a S like Security: the eBPF XDP case
    by Eric Leblond (Suricata core developer, Stamus Networks)
~~~ morning pause ~~~
  • 10:30 - 11:05: KEYNOTE: a 10 years journey in Linux firewalling
    by Pablo Neira Ayuso (Head of Netfilter core team)
  • 11:05 - 11:40: Full packet capture for the masses
    by Xavier Mertens (Security veteran)
  • 11:40 - 12:15: Rumps session
~~~ MID DAY BREAK ~~~

Web Security Session

  • 14:15 - 14:50: Security and Self-Driving Computers
    by Stefan Eissing (Mod_md developer (Let’s Encrypt Apache module))
  • 14:50 - 15:25: Snuffleupageaus: Snuffleupagus - Killing bug classes and virtual patching the rest
    by Julien ‘jvoisin’ voisin (NBS Systems)
  • 15:25 - 15:45: Vulture: Preview of Vulture’s upcoming web filtering engine
    by Jérémie JOURDIN (Vulture dev, aDvens) and Hugo SOSZYNSKI (RetDec main developer, Avast software)
  • 15:45 - 16:05: SecureDrop, for whistle-blowers
    by François Poulain (SecureDrop community member & server maintenance) and Loïc Darchary (SecureDrop dev)
~~~ afternoon pause ~~~

IAM Session

  • 16:25 - 17:00: LemonLDAP::NG: Second factor authentication (2FA)
    by Clément Oudot (LemonLDAP::NG developer) and Xavier Guimard (LemonLDAP::NG creator and developer)
  • 17:00 - 17:35: [Yet to Be Confirmed] No way JOSE! Lessons for authors and implementers of open standards
    by Fraser Tweedale (Haskel Jose library maintainer, Redhat)
  • 17:35 - 17:55: FreeIPA
    by Florence Blanc-Renaud (Senior Software Engineer working on FreeIPA, Redhat)

Wednesday 4th of July, 2018

Threat Intel Session

  • 09:00 - 09:35: Fail frequently to avoid disaster, or how to organically build an open threat intelligence sharing standard to keep the intelligence community free and sane!
    by Alexandre Dulaunoy (CIRCL) and Andras Iklody (CIRCL)
  • 09:35 - 10:10: The story of Greendale
    by Thomas Chopitea (Forensics investigator and engineer, Google)
~~~ morning pause ~~~

Secure Programming and Architecture Session

  • 10:30 - 11:05: Internals of Landlock: a new kind of Linux Security Module leveraging eBPF
    by Mickaël Salaün (security researcher, ANSSI)
  • 11:05 - 11:40: Secure programming are slow - really ?
    by Pierre Chifflier (Head of the intrusion detection research lab, ANSSI)
  • 11:40 - 12:15: Immutable infrastructure and zero trust networking: designing your system for resilience
    by Geoffroy Couprie (Security researcher and developer, Clever Cloud)
~~~ MID DAY BREAK ~~~

IoT Security Session

  • 14:15 - 14:50: IoT Honeypot, new types of attacks
    by Sebastien Tricaud (Open source and security pro and enthusiast, Splunk)
  • 14:50 - 15:25: Io(M)T Security: A year in review
    by Rayna Stamboliyska (risk management and crisis mitigation expert)
  • 15:25 - 16:00: Expl-iot: IoT Security Testing Framework
    by Aseem Jakhar (R&D director, Payatu software lab)
~~~ afternoon pause ~~~

Offensive Session

  • 16:20 - 16:40: Freedom Fighting Mode - Open Source Hacking Harness
    by Ivan Kwiatkowski (pentester and malware analyst, Kaspersky)
  • 16:40 - 17:00: Open Hardware for (software) offensive security
    by Antoine Cervoise (IT security engineer, NTT Security)
  • 17:00 - 17:20: Shadow on the Wall - Risks and Flaws with Shadowsocks
    by Niklas Abel (Pentester and security auditor, X41)
  • 17:20 - 17:40: Glassfish from (IN)Secure admin
    by Jeremy Mousset (Pentester, Vente-privee.com)
